record.field: AIR
Time spent flying in the air.
TOT
Total flight time, including all types of flying.
PIC
Pilot in Command (PIC) time, representing time when the pilot is responsible for the operation and safety of the aircraft.
SIC
Second in Command (SIC) time, representing time when a qualified pilot is acting as a co-pilot under the command of the PIC.
DUL
Dual instruction time, representing time spent receiving instruction from a certified flight instructor.
PICUS
Pilot in Command Under Supervision (PICUS) time, representing time when a pilot operates an aircraft under the supervision of a qualified PIC.
INS
Instructor time, representing time spent instructing other pilots.
EXM
Examiner time, representing time spent conducting flight tests and evaluations.
NIT
Night flying time, representing time spent flying during nighttime hours.
XC
Cross-country flying time, representing time spent flying between different locations.
IFR
Instrument flight rules (IFR) time, representing time spent flying under conditions where the pilot relies solely on instruments for navigation.
HOD
Time spent flying with a vision-restricting device (often called a "hood") to simulate instrument flying conditions.
IMC
Actual instrument flying time, representing time spent flying under actual instrument meteorological conditions (IMC).
REL
Time spent as relief pilot, representing time spent relieving the primary pilot during long flights or for rest breaks.
